data.title: Greek salad, baby!
data.text: I got the Greek salad with chicken. Oh my gosh, it was so very good. Generous portion and the chicken was very tender. Fantastic flavor, beautiful colors - I mean what more could you ask for? Service was quick and attentive. I'm making plans to come back again.

data.title: Tasty Discovery!
data.text:
Hidden a bit in Miramar Town Center and opened just 2 months, we welcome a new Greek refreshing spot. Decided to stop in and try, this small storefront is a nice spot to drop in for some Greek food. 
Our Server was Edison "Eddie" who was charming and honest when I asked him questions.  I highly recommend him.  He made sure our table was always clean and glasses filled. On top of everything, makes a wonderful impression. He passed all my tests with flying colors. They are still working on the menu and I am sure more to come.  
The falafel appetizer was very tasty. Our Entrees - The Mediterranean Sea Bass, cooked to perfection with lots of flavor. Highly recommend for fish lovers. The Greek Grill Mix had lamb, chicken and kefte kabob I liked having a variety. The French fries were bursting with flavor and when you dip it into tzatziki, Yummy! 
The end was a delicious Cheesecake Baklava. A must!!!!
I will not lie, this is not a traditional full style restaurant, it is storefront, casual, quick eat in or take out. But, more cafe style. 
Definitely worth a try.

data.title: Excellent Mediterranean Food
data.text: Visited this restaurant today for dinner and I found that the food was excellent, the service was on spot. My husband and I both ordered the lamb gyro and for an appetizer we had the spinach pie. The spinach pie was not your usual pie, it was actually 3 small pieces, so if you are accustomed to what you get in other greek restaurants don't look for it here. The lamb Gyro was excellent, it did not have a heavy taste that remains with you after eating. It was served over rice with a side salad, which was also excellent. I barely finished my dish, it was so good. Planning on returning to try some of their other dishes.

data.title: Mediterranean jewel!
data.text: Located between DD and Juan's this little Mediterranean jewel is blessing for the Miramar area.  The ambiance is very nice, great music, the food is very fresh (they made everything in the restaurant) the hummus is deliciously addictive and the lamb chops melt in your mouth, the salad and the veggies are great. The gyro is the best that I ever had, the pistachio baklava is to die for! Turkish coffee to much for a Cuban palate. Tara the server is great, very energetic and helpful with the customers. Decent wine and beer selection. Acceptable prices and portions. Clean restrooms and plenty parking spaces.

data.title: Excellent Find
data.text:
This restaurant is a hidden secret.  Only open a couple of months, my wife and I really enjoyed our visit.  The restaurant is small and has a nice warm feel.  The staff was very friendly.

We started out with Humus and Baba Ghanouj.  The portion sizes were perfect for a couple, we probably could have had just one but they were both delicious.  My wife had a Gyro, which was huge and large side of fries.  I had the chicken souvlaki skewer with a side of vegetables and salad.  Again, the food was delicious.  Along with two beers, the total bill was $41.00, so a very good price.  If you use Groupon, we snagged one for this restaurant, which made the deal even better.  We will be back, for sure.

data.title: Tasty Greek food
data.text: The food was tasty and the ingredients looked fresh. Restaurant is new and clean.  Portions were a bit on the small side but the service was good.  Will return.

data.title: Have a great time at a new restaurant
data.text: We came here as it was a new restaurant in our area. We had a great time and we really enjoyed our meal. The food was great and we plan to come here again really soon.
